fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces

Interface VariableInitialisationI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AtomicModelI, AtomicSimulatorI, CoordinatorI, CoupledModelI, ModelI, RTAtomicSimulatorI, RTSimulatorI, SimulatorI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPlottingHIOA, AbstractWall, AtomicEngine, AtomicES_Model, AtomicHIOA, AtomicModel, AtomicRTEngine, BankCoupledModel, BankModel, BasicCounterCoupledModel, BasicCounterModel, BatterySensorModel, ClientGenerator, ClientGeneratorModel, ControllerModel, CoordinationEngine, CoordinationRTEngine, CoupledModel, DependentCounterModel, HIOA_Consumer, HIOA_CoupledModel, HIOA_Generator, HIOA_Multiplier, InsideWall, Model, MoleneModel, NetworkModel, OutsideTemperature, OutsideWall, PortableComputerModel, PortableComputerStateModel, ServerModel, ServerModel, SimulationEngine, SSQueueCoupledES_Model, ThermostatCoupledModel, ThermostaticHeater, Tic_ES_Model, TicModel, TicModel, WiFiBandwidthModel, WiFiBandwidthSensorModel, WiFiDisconnectionModel, WiFiModel

    public interface VariableInitialisationI
    The interface VariableInitialisationI defines methods used to implement the initialisation of variables in HIOA models, including a fix point initialisation protocol to cater for dependencies among distinct models variables.

    Description

    TODO

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       true        // no invariant

    Created on : 2022-06-28

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean allModelVariablesInitialised()
      return true if all model variables are fully initialised (relevant for HIOA models).
      default boolean allModelVariablesTimeInitialised()
      return true if all model variables have their associated time initialised (relevant for HIOA models).
      default Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> fixpointInitialiseVariables()
      initialise the model variables with a more elaborated protocol when external model variables depend of each others, hence models importing variables have to wait until these variables are themselves initialised so this protocol will allow to call repetitively the method until all variables are initialised without having to respect any order among models (but models cannot have circular dependencies); this method must be called after the method initialiseState.
      default void initialiseVariables()
      initialise the model variables with a simple protocol when external model variables are fully independent of each others, hence each model can initialise them in any order; this method must be called after the method initialiseState.
      default void staticInitialiseVariables()
      initialise the internal data structures of the atomic HIOA model from the static information about the model variables; this method must be called immediately after creating an atomic HIOA model and before composing it with other models i.e., is an integral part of the model creation protocol.
      default boolean useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
      return true if the model uses the fixpoint algorithm to initialise its model variables, false otherwise; when true, the method fixpointInitialiseVariables must be implemented by the model, and when false, it is the method initialiseVariables that must be.

    • Method Detail

      • staticInitialiseVariables

        default void staticInitialiseVariables()
        initialise the internal data structures of the atomic HIOA model from the static information about the model variables; this method must be called immediately after creating an atomic HIOA model and before composing it with other models i.e., is an integral part of the model creation protocol.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.

      • initialiseVariables

        default void initialiseVariables()
        initialise the model variables with a simple protocol when external model variables are fully independent of each others, hence each model can initialise them in any order; this method must be called after the method initialiseState.

        Contract

         pre     !allModelVariablesInitialised()
 pre     !useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
 post    allModelVariablesInitialised()

      • useFixpointInitialiseVariables

        default boolean useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
        return true if the model uses the fixpoint algorithm to initialise its model variables, false otherwise; when true, the method fixpointInitialiseVariables must be implemented by the model, and when false, it is the method initialiseVariables that must be.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        true if the model uses the fixpoint algorithm to initialise its model variables, false otherwise.

      • allModelVariablesTimeInitialised

        default boolean allModelVariablesTimeInitialised()
        return true if all model variables have their associated time initialised (relevant for HIOA models).

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        true if all model variables have their associated time initialised.

      • allModelVariablesInitialised

        default boolean allModelVariablesInitialised()
        return true if all model variables are fully initialised (relevant for HIOA models).

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Returns:
        true if all model variables are fully initialised.

      • fixpointInitialiseVariables

        default Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> fixpointInitialiseVariables()
        initialise the model variables with a more elaborated protocol when external model variables depend of each others, hence models importing variables have to wait until these variables are themselves initialised so this protocol will allow to call repetitively the method until all variables are initialised without having to respect any order among models (but models cannot have circular dependencies); this method must be called after the method initialiseState.

        Contract

         pre     useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
 pre     allModelVariablesTimeInitialised()
 post    ret.getFirst() >= 0 && ret.getSecond() >= 0
 post    !(ret.getFirst() >= 0 || ret.getSecond() == 0) || allModelVariablesInitialised()
        Returns:
        a pair which first element is the number of newly initialised variables (i.e.) and the second the number of non initialised yet variables.
